basics.name: Khanh Nguyen
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Engineering at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Fall, 2023.

highlights:
Plan a six-week summer program that provides free summer school classes, resource workshops, and college-
based activities to 60+ students transitioning into their first year of college

Manage multiple projects by leading groups such as the Registered Independent Organization, Peer Mentors, and
Program Team to provide leadership activities to assist first-generation college students to strengthen a support
network of 400+ HUI students, alumni, and campus resources

Offer opportunities for students to learn more about college and HUI through high school visits, campus tours,
recruitment events, and informational sessions to get students excited about their future

Received daily presentations and mentorship from industry professionals on topics ranging from data analytics,
photovoltaics, battery energy storage systems, project development, asset management, and construction

Utilized Python to filter Excel files containing all lost energy data to determine total energy lost due to
curtailment and maintenance in a year span to calculate revenue losses from Kawailoa Solar Farm

Presented a final project proposal to build a Battery Energy Storage System (BESS) to store curtailed energy to
provide an extra 16,000MWh annually for Oahu to power over 32,000 homes for a month

Projects.summary: Powertrain Lead for development of UH Manoa's first electric vehicle
highlights:
Documented different stages of the design process with the team to draft reports, notebooks, and presentations
such as the 1st place Francis Rhodes Montgomery Design Competition presentation

Facilitated communication between the accumulator/electronics and drivetrain team to integrate components such
as the battery cooling system and pedal assembly into the powertrain system

Drafted circuit diagrams using SOLIDWORKS PCB for preliminary designs of the low voltage and high voltage
lithium-ion tractive system

Developed high voltage infrastructure including lab space and safety operating procedures for UH Manoaâ€™s
Mechanical Engineering Shop Space

Gathered information on alternative applications of liquid-metal to optimize manufacturing procedure for small
scale electronics

Designed experimental set up using silicon stamps to apply liquid-metal into finer resolutions using additive and
subtractive methods
